definition: to break up/to divide property and live apart/to start on a new (path)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: So Gerber used his last $700 to start another company.
sentences.chinese: 於是，戈貝爾用他剩餘的700美元另開了一家公司。

sentences.english: He is thinking of starting another firm in Paris.
sentences.chinese: 他正在考慮在巴黎另開一家公司。
